ratings.comment: Really do not take fin320 from them. Do not take. find it from someone else. . I have found infuriating the disposition of Robattto in lecture (which is discombobulated, extremely difficult to follow and quasi incomprehensible, and style of instruction is at an elementary level). I wish we did practice problems that will be on the exam in class.

I sat in every lecture with genuinely no clue what Robatto was talking about, ever. On top of his heavy accent, his monotone voice is incredibly boring. Lots of math concepts lectured on with very few exercises to actually practice them. Only reason not 1 star is because the grading isn't the hardest. Just an insufferably boring course by Robatto.
He is just an objectively bad professor, do anything else.  if you need the credit - drop out

Prof. Robatto was a decent professor. From the other ratings, I believed he has improved his teaching skills a lot, and is very knowledgeable on the topic. However, I can concur that the lectures were boring and there was a lack of flow to a lot of the lectures. Definitely wasn't a horrible professor, but not top-tier. Exams similar to practice.

Boring lectures. He clearly tries to make more interesting with examples from the news and stuff, but it falls flat. The group problem sets are the actual worst because often seems like the material on them isn't covered at all in class. Have to google and get from outside resources. He seems really smart, but maybe just not the best professor.

Clearly knows a lot about the material, but was not born to teach. Awful lectures. Boring, lack of flow and direction. Do not recommend to anyone. Avoid at all costs if you want to learn and stay motivated.

Probably the worst professor in the business school. Lectures often make no sense, he never gives any feedback on tests/homework, and his tests are horribly written. He's a knowledgeable guy that knows a lot about finance, but should absolutely not be a professor. Take anybody else for FIN 320.
One of the worst teachers I've ever had. Horrible at explaining the material and is incredibly boring and awkward. Do not take this class if you actually want to learn.
Nice guy but simply not a good lecturer. Relies heavily on algebraic proofs and hard-to-digest statistics. Makes learning the concepts difficult. On top of that, lecture was mandatory.

Not a good professor. Seems nice enough and likes finance, but this class is boring, attendance is taken, group projects are a large part of the grade. Not to mention that Roberto just isn't a very good instructor. I relied more on the book than him to actually learn the concepts.

He has the passion on both teaching and the subject (finance), and the course itself is pretty dry but he tried as much as he could to make it enjoyable, like using blackboard for question solving and slides for concept, connect concepts to real situation in recent news. Accent is not that bad even for me as an intentional student.

Lectures are very boring, not very good at explaining concepts and slides have errors. Over half of the class skips class. Midterm was fair and final was tough. Not as generous of a curve as most expected. Take with another professor.
